NETHERBOUND Chapter 2 “There But For The Grace of God” Completed


05 Nov 2015

That‚Äôs right! I spent most of the day pounding out the second chapter of NETHERBOUND. It‚Äôs a little shorter but it explains a lot. We start from the point at which Escape Velocity (the previous novel) ended and we skew it, we warp it and we connect it in fragmented shards that tell little significant details about what exactly happened.

He‚Äôs awoken 223 years into the future, but this fact is not mentioned, yet.

He‚Äôs incarcerated and blamed for wiping out most of humanity

He escapes prison, regardless and reunites with a mysterious and unexplained version of Meryl SinGarda, and then we find out that he is no longer he, or Dante.

This chapter is where I tie the two books together, provide some closure for the extremely anticlimactic end to Escape Velocity and provide the framework for the rest of NETHERBOUD. So if you‚Äôve read Escape Velocity and you‚Äôre dying to know just what the hell happens next, you can now not only find out where we are in the story, but how (sort of) we got there.

Stay tuned for chapter 3, ‚ÄúTransmission From Hell.‚Äù

Click here to start at the beginning of chapter 2, or here to start from chapter 1.

NETHERBOUND Chapter One Completed!


04 Nov 2015

As of today, the rough draft for chapter one in the explosive, dark and moody sequel to Escape Velocity is complete! As I‚Äôve mentioned before, I‚Äôm doing what I‚Äôm calling a ‚Äúlive rough drafting‚Äù of the story over on Tumblr for all to read as it happens.

If you haven‚Äôt seen any of it yet, or aren‚Äôt sure how to get to the beginning of the story, click this link to start from the beginning. Each section of chapter one has links at the top and the bottom for chapter navigation, should you get lost, or need to go backward. I‚Äôm sure Morgan wishes she could!

So far, as the story goes, we‚Äôve met a brand new character in #thepaxseries (or so you think), trapped on a ship named the Tredecim (latin for the number thirteen). As she learns that the situation is less than beneficial to her survival, she sets out to not only figure out what happened, why everyone is dead, but to find the passcode that she needs in order to force the ship out of hyperspace.

Hyperspace, which she discovers to be the depths of a black hole.

Stay tuned for more!

#thepaxseries returns!


02 Nov 2015

Hello everybody! It‚Äôs Meryl S. Kavanagh, author of PaxCorpus and Escape Velocity! I have returned from the darkness to bring to you the most concrete evidence that I am still alive! I know some of you may have read Escape Velocity and are probably going nuts wondering what in the hell happens next, right? So instead of making people wait even longer (since I‚Äôve had so many hiccups and issues over 2015) I‚Äôm writing the sequel to Escape Velocity live on Tumblr.

I‚Äôm callling it a live serial drafting, so basically you can read the rough draft as I write it, in small ‚Äúbite‚Äù sized pieces that are easier to digest than having a full novel chapter shoved at you.

You can find the NETHERBOUND serial project here on its Tumblr blog (if you‚Äôre uncertain how to find the installments, click the NB Serial link at the top of the page), where you can read character profiles, look over my previous books and read each chapter as they‚Äôre written! Currently there is a small piece of the first chapter on display and ready to read. ‚ÄúThe End of Everything‚Äù chapter 1.2 is coming soon as a continuation to the beginning of the novel that will redefine #thepaxseries in every possible way.

Leave comments, tell me what you think and most importantly, enjoy!
